summary: The "Paying a Fair Share Act of 2025" aims to impose an additional tax on high-income earners. It adds a new part (VIII) to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, establishing a "Fair Share Tax." This tax is calculated as 30% of the excess of adjusted gross income over the modified charitable contribution deduction. High-income taxpayers are defined as those with adjusted gross income exceeding $1,000,000 (with an inflation adjustment). The bill also includes a 'Sense of the House' section advocating for broader tax reform, including the elimination of tax loopholes and a fairer tax system.
